newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stock fund flows turn positive -- survey.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stock fund flows turn positive -- survey.

text.p: U.S. stock funds recorded estimated inflows of about $1.31 billion for the two days ended April 7 compared to outflows of $883 million for the three days ended April 3, according to a survey by Mutual Fund Trim Tabs.

According to data compiled by the fund tracking firm, growth funds posted inflows of $426 million versus outflows of $983 million, aggressive growth funds had inflows of $579 million versus outflows of $443 million. Growth and income fund flows slowed to inflows of $204 million from $692 million.

Bond funds suffered estimated industry outflows of $395 million compared to inflows of $184 million. Muni funds had outflows of $181 million versus inflows of $302 million, and government/GNMA funds had outflows of $139 million versus inflows of $32 million.
